Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown-orange pottery vessel, the interior is covered with a cream-coloured deposit, the exterior is covered with a thin light-brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393299) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393299)
